problem.p: Choose the correct type of block for each specified block. If the block is not a command block and not a function, choose the not a function option.

div.p: The Greater Than Block: Consider the case where we have two numbers x and y. If x is less than y, the block will report true, otherwise false. So the block is a predicate.
The Addition Block: For every pair of numbers (x, y), the addition block will return their unique sum, i.e. a number. So the block is a reporter.
The Pick Random Block: Each call of the block returns different outsputs; this means that this block is not a functiona and so not a reporter.

The Move Block: Assume we call the move block for 10 steps. The block itself will not return a value and will move the sprite; in other words, it affects it's environment. So it cannot be a funtion and therefore not a predicate nor a reporter. Then it is a command block.
